title: 'Don’t commit the same mistake', Stalin warns BJP on Amit Shah’s Hindi remark - Deccan Herald
content:
1. 'Don’t commit the same mistake', Stalin warns BJP on Amit Shah’s Hindi remark  Deccan Herald
  2. Amit Shah's Renewed Hindi Push: Opposition Slams Home Minister's 'Imposition' Of 'Language Of India'  TIMES NOW
  3. Hindi should be alternative to English: Amit Shah  Times of India
  4. BJP unleashing ‘cultural terrorism’ against non-Hindi speaking States: Congress  The Hindu
  5. After Amit Shah’s remark on use of Hindi, AAP leader raises concern over impact on Goa tourism  ThePrint
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin on Friday fumed at Union Home Minister Amit Shah for asking people of different states to communicate with each other in the "language of India", saying his statement is an act that “will hurt the unity of India” and warned the BJP not to “commit the same mistake.
